nl.naturalis.nda.elasticsearch.client

Interface Index

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IndexNative, IndexREST

    public interface Index
    Interface defining methods for classes operating on a single ElasticSearch index.
    Author:
    ayco_holleman

    • Method Detail

      • exists

        boolean exists()
        Whether or not the index has already been created.
        Returns:
        true if yes, false if not.

      • typeExists

        boolean typeExists(java.lang.String type)
        Whether or not a mapping exists for the specified document type.
        Parameters:
        type - The document type to verify
        Returns:
        @return true if yes, false if not.

      • describe

        java.lang.String describe()
        Describe the index (i.e. its mapping).
        Returns:
        The mapping or null the index has not been created yet.

      • describeAllIndices

        java.lang.String describeAllIndices()
        Describes all indices (i.e. their mappings) in the cluster. This is one of the methods that does not specifically operate against the encapsulated index. For ease of use it is still a non-static method.
        Returns:
        The mappings

      • create

        void create()
        Creates an empty index with one shard and zero replicas.

            int numReplicas)
        Creates an empty index with the specified number of shards and replicas
        Parameters:
        numShards - The number of shards
        numReplicas - The number of replicas

      • create

        void create(java.lang.String settings)

      • delete

        boolean delete()
        Delete the index and all its types and data from the cluster.
        Returns:
        true if the index existed and was successfully deleted; false if the index did not exist.

      • addType

        void addType(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.String mapping)
        Adds a new type to the index or overrides an existing one.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the type
        mapping - The mapping for the type

      • deleteType

        boolean deleteType(java.lang.String name)
        Deletes the specified type (along with all documents of that type) from the index.
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:

      • deleteAllIndices

        void deleteAllIndices()
        Delete all indices and their data from the cluster. Handle with care! This is one of the methods that does not specifically operate against the encapsulated index. For ease of use it is still a non-static method.

      • saveObject

        void saveObject(java.lang.String type,
                java.lang.Object obj,
                java.lang.String id)
        Adds the specified object to the index.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the document
        obj - The object to add
        id - The document ID

      • saveObject

        void saveObject(java.lang.String type,
                java.lang.Object obj,
                java.lang.String id,
                java.lang.String parentId)
        Adds the specified object to the index.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the document
        obj - The object to add
        id - The document ID. Specify null if you want the ID to be auto-generated by ElasticSearch.
        parentId - the document ID of the parent

      • saveObjects

        void saveObjects(java.lang.String type,
                 java.util.List<?> objs)
        Adds multiple objects to the index, presumably using ElasticSearch's bulk processing capabilities.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the document
        objs - The objects to add

      • saveObjects

        void saveObjects(java.lang.String type,
                 java.util.List<?> objs,
                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> ids)
        Adds multiple objects to the index, presumably using ElasticSearch's bulk processing capabilities.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the document
        objs - The objects to add
        ids - The ids of the objects to add. For each object you must specify an ID. In other words the sizes of the list and the list must be equal. If you want Lucene to generate the IDs for you, specify null.

      • saveObjects

        void saveObjects(java.lang.String type,
                 java.util.List<?> objs,
                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> ids,
                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> parentIds)
        Adds multiple objects to the index, presumably using ElasticSearch's bulk processing capabilities.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the document
        objs - The objects to add
        ids - The ids of the objects to add. For each object you must specify an ID. In other words the sizes of the list and the list must be equal. If you want Lucene to generate the IDs for you, specify null.
        parentIds - The IDs of the parents of the objects. Specify null if the objects do not have a relational parent.
